citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Collinsella stercoris sp. nov.
Collinsella stercoris (ster'co.ris. L. n. stercus faeces; L. gen. n. stercoris of faeces, referring to the source of the isolate)
Cells are 0.3-0.4x1.3-2.4 μm in size and occur in chains of 2-20 cells.
Colonies are white or grey in the centre with clear margins on EG agar.
Can be cultivated for 2 d at 37 °C on EG agar in an anaerobic jar with 100% CO2.

Cells produce acid from glucose, mannose, galactose, fructose, maltose, cellobiose, lactose and salicin, but not from L-arabinose, D-xylose, rhamnose, ribose, sucrose, trehalose, raffinose, melezitose, starch, glycogen, mannitol, sorbitol, inositol, erythritol, aesculin or amygdalin.

Cells show strong activity of leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, but do not show any activity of lipase (C4), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
Cell wall contains A4β-type peptidoglycan with an (L-Ala)-D-Glu-L-Orn-D-Asp peptide subunit, and interpeptide bridge consists only of D- Asp.
